article_title: How Companies Can Stop Information Theft by Employees
article_text:
The National Security Agency spent the summer of 2013 fighting a series of leaks about its activities because one disgruntled system administrator had the ability to access and reveal a trove of NSA documents undetected.

But the actions of former NSA contractor Edward Snowden offered at least one benefit to U.S. corporations: a lesson in the dangers of cyberthreats that come from inside an organization.
